intro: Polyscias neoebudarum, commonly known as the New Guinea glory bush, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by bright red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage.
